The following table shows the types of payment most frequently made under site agreements (see [EIM13825](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13825)) and the appropriate tax treatment. See [EIM13832](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13832) for the report to be made in certain cases.
### Type of payment ### Tax treatment
Completion bonus or time-saved payment: this is a sum paid for completing a contract before a specified date. Payment for completing a project on time. Retention payment: this is based on the number of hours worked.Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM00515](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00515)). The sum is a reward for services in the form of a contractually guaranteed terminal payment (see [EIM13765](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13765)).
Severance payment (excluding a statutory redundancy payment). Usually related to length of service and paid where an employment lasts less than 2 years.May satisfy the definition of payments for redundancy (see [EIM13800](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13800)) and so fall within Section 401 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM13775](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13775)). Otherwise, Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM00515](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00515)).
Payment in lieu of notice (PILON).See [EIM12975](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12975)
Statutory redundancy payment made under Employment Rights Act 1996 or Northern Ireland equivalent (see [EIM13760](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13760)).Section 401 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM13760](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13760)).
